physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal vital signs and oxygen saturation.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Thin, alert, and oriented with an appropriate affect. Right tympanic membrane perforation with dried blood in the external canal. Enlarged (3+) and erythematous tonsils. Dysarthric speech with slight saccadic undershoot and normal pursuit; hearing diminished in the right ear. Dysmetria bilaterally and truncal ataxia with standing and walking.

Patient was awake and cooperative but inattentive. Mild anomia and impaired verbal fluency and working memory. Eye movements showed hypometric saccades and catch-up. Dysdiadochokinesia and dysmetria on testing; wide-based, unsteady gait; unable to perform tandem walking.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression in cognitive impairment and ataxia noted compared to initial examination.
